sections.summary: The Overnight Reverse Repurchase (ON RRP) facility is where money market funds (MMFs) park excess cash at the Fed. Think of it as the 'overflow tank' for the financial system's liquidity.
sections.deep_dive: When the RRP balance falls, that cash enters the banking system (often buying T-Bills), effectively increasing Net Liquidity. It acted as a massive liquidity cushion in 2024-2025, neutralizing the impact of QT (Quantitative Tightening).
sections.council_debate: {"geopolitics": "Foreign central banks also use the Foreign RRP facility. sections.forecast_risks: The 'Zero Bound Risk'. Once RRP hits zero, the liquidity buffer is gone. Any shock after that point (e.g., unexpectedly larger T-Bill issuance) causes an immediate liquidity crisis.
sections.gms_conclusion: The buffer is wearing thin. We are transitioning from a world of 'Abundant Reserves' to 'Ample Reserves'. Watch this level daily.
